snippet: The attorney general of West Virginia conceded that its ban on same-sex marriage was no longer defensible after a Supreme Court ruling Monday, but officials in South Carolina vowed to keep fighting.
abstract: West Virginia attorney general concedes that its ban on same-sex marriage is no longer defensible after a Supreme Court ruling legalizing it in five states; officials in South Carolina vow to keep fighting.
lead_paragraph: The attorney general of West Virginia conceded that its ban on same-sex marriage was no longer defensible after a Supreme Court ruling Monday, but officials in South Carolina vowed to keep fighting.

headline.main: Same-Sex Marriage Ruling Echoes as West Virginia Relents and South Carolina Persists
headline.print_headline: Marriage Ruling Echoes as West Virginia Relents and South Carolina Persists

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
